meanings.definition: The quality or state of being tyrannical.
meanings.sent1: His tyrannicalnesses were evident in the way he controlled every aspect of our lives.
meanings.sent2: The tyrannicalnesses of the dictator were felt by all the citizens.
meanings.sent3: The classroom teddy bear's tyrannicalnesses were revealed when he demanded all the crayons for himself.
meanings.sent4: The shadow of his tyrannicalnesses loomed over the kingdom, casting a dark cloud over its people.
meanings.sent5: The weight of her tyrannicalnesses pressed down on the hearts of those under her rule.

meanings.definition: The actions or behavior of a tyrant.
meanings.sent1: The tyrannicalnesses of the king included harsh punishments for minor offenses.
meanings.sent2: In history, the tyrannicalnesses of rulers often led to uprisings among the people.
meanings.sent3: The cat's tyrannicalnesses were on full display when it knocked over all the flower vases.
meanings.sent4: The storm of his tyrannicalnesses raged on, leaving destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The tyrannicalnesses of the boss made the workplace a stressful environment for everyone.

meanings.definition: The oppressive or unjust exercise of power.
meanings.sent1: The tyrannicalnesses of the government restricted the freedom of the citizens.
meanings.sent2: Under the tyrannicalnesses of the landlord, the tenants lived in fear of eviction.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's tyrannicalnesses emerged when he refused to share his toys with his friends.
meanings.sent4: The dark cloud of his tyrannicalnesses hung over the village, suffocating its spirit.
meanings.sent5: The tyrannicalnesses of the corporation led to widespread protests against their policies.
